history.content:
Good question! Unfortunately the Office of the Registrar can only post undergraduate degrees once. If you're on the degree list, any majors you have declared and completed will be conferred, and your transcript will be sealed (no more classes, no more updates, etc). I wonder if the college or the registrar would be willing to write you a letter verifying that you've completed the requirements for your first degree (you would have to ask them), but that's definitely as official as it can get. 


Sorry

children.subject: Thanks for the reply, Nicole!  I appreciate it :)

history.content:
Hi EECS Community and Advising Staff!

I am planning on applying for a double major in Energy and EECS.  However, this would push back my graduation from Spring 2018 to Summer 2018.  I would still complete one major by Spring 2018, then take two classes in Summer 2018 to finish the other.

Problem:  this might be too late for some graduate programs that begin Fall 2018 and require proof of my Bachelor's degree completion (I'm in the process of emailing various grad programs currently...)

Is there any way I can obtain proof of my completion of the 1st degree in Spring 2018?  Could my 1st degree be posted to my official transcript before my 2nd degree?  Or must I wait until after the Summer 2018 semester to have both degrees on my transcript?

Given I don't want to delay my graduate school start, this definitely impacts whether I will proceed with the double major or not.

Thank you for any information!
history.subject: Proof of Completion of 1st degree for Double Major
